message.content:
cs.CR, cs.NI, cs.LG, cs.SE, cs.DS 

The paper deals with the security aspects of mobile supported collaborative framework (MSCF) and introduces a new intrusion detection system (IDS) to detect and block malicious attacks. This makes it highly likely to belong to the cs.CR (Cryptography and Security) and cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture) sub-categories. The paper also introduces novel algorithms and rules, which suggests a focus on machine learning and data analysis, making cs.LG (Machine Learning) a likely sub-category as well. Additionally, the paper discusses the validation of the proposed mechanism through simulation, indicating a focus on software engineering and testing, making cs.SE (Software Engineering) a possible sub-category. Finally, the paper deals with the detection and prevention of rogue DHCP servers, which suggests a focus on network security and protocols, making cs.DS (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing) a possible sub-category.
